P:MCWrapper.RPC.Options.RpcOptions.ChainRpcPort
member.summary:
RPC port number as declared in the params.dat file or as override value in multichain.conf
ChainRpcPort number is required for the RPC client to function as expected;

member.name: P:MCWrapper.RPC.Options.RpcOptions.ChainAdminAddress
P:MCWrapper.RPC.Options.RpcOptions.ChainHostname
member.summary:
IPv4 or FQDN of where the MultiChain network is hosted and/or accessible
ChainHostname is required for the RPC client to function as expected;

member.name: P:MCWrapper.RPC.Options.RpcOptions.ChainBurnAddress
member.summary:
Blockchain address used for 'burning' Assets/Streams. This is not a required property, however, it is nice to have the value available at the code level in case assets/streams do need to be burned.
ChainBurnAddress is not required for the RPC client to function as expected;

member.name: P:MCWrapper.RPC.Options.RpcOptions.ChainUsername
member.summary:
RPCJSON username for target blockchain
ChainUsername is required for the RPC client to function as expected;

member.name: P:MCWrapper.RPC.Options.RpcOptions.ChainPassword
member.summary:
RPCJSON password for target blockchain
ChainPassword is required for the RPC client to function as expected;

member.name: P:MCWrapper.RPC.Options.RpcOptions.ChainUseSsl
member.summary:
SSL Flag
ChainUseSsl is not required for the RPC client to function as expected; However, if you wish to transact with the node using HTTPS this value must be and equal true
Please note: If the ChainUseSsl value is true, the ChainSslPath value MUST be populated and accurate. When starting an HTTPS blockahin ensure you pass the -rpcssl flag and properly configure your multichain.conf file properly to support HTTPS connection.

member.name: P:MCWrapper.RPC.Options.RpcOptions.ChainSslPath

member.name: M:MCWrapper.RPC.Extensions.MultiChainCoreRpcServices.AddMultiChainCoreRpcServices(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection)
member.summary:
Add MultiChain Remote Procedure Call (RPC) services to an application's service container.
Be aware a MultiChain blockchain network must be installed and configured externally from this application.
The MultiChain library and installation instructions are availabale at https://multichain.com
This method automatically loads the BlockchainProfileOptions and RuntimeParamOptions from the local environment variable store.
member.param: Service container

member.name: M:MCWrapper.RPC.Extensions.MultiChainCoreRpcServices.AddMultiChainCoreRpcServices(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.IConfiguration)
member.summary:
Add MultiChain Remote Procedure Call (RPC) services to an application's service container.
Be aware a MultiChain blockchain network must be installed and configured externally from this application.
The MultiChain library and installation instructions are availabale at https://multichain.com
This method automatically loads the BlockchainProfileOptions and RuntimeParamOptions from the IConfiguration interface (appsettings.json file usually).
member.param: Service container
Configuration pipeline

member.name: M:MCWrapper.RPC.Extensions.MultiChainCoreRpcServices.AddMultiChainCoreRpcServices(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Action{MCWrapper.RPC.Options.RpcOptions},System.Action{MCWrapper.Ledger.Entities.Options.RuntimeParamOptions})
member.summary:
Add MultiChain Remote Procedure Call (RPC) services to an application's service container.
Be aware a MultiChain blockchain network must be installed and configured externally from this application.
The MultiChain library and installation instructions are availabale at https://multichain.com
This method requires the BlockchainProfileOptions and RuntimeParamOptions property values to be explicitly passed via the and Action parameters when added to the DI pipeline.
member.param: Service container
Blockchain profile configuration (Information the app will use to connect to a MultiChain ledger)
Runtime parameter configuration (How a MultiChain ledger should behave)

member.name: M:MCWrapper.RPC.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainRpcMiningClient.PrioritiseTransactionAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.Double)

summary.para: Accepts the transaction into mined blocks at a higher (or lower) priority
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.

member.param: Name of target blockchain
String value to identify this transaction
The transaction id

The priority to add or subtract.
The transaction selection algorithm considers the tx as it would have a higher priority.
(priority of a transaction is calculated: coinage * value_in_satoshis / txsize)

The fee value (in satoshis) to add (or subtract, if negative).
The fee is not actually paid, only the algorithm for selecting transactions into a block considers the transaction as it would have paid a higher (or lower) fee

he fee is not actually paid, only the algorithm for selecting transactions into a block considers the transaction as it would have paid a higher (or lower) fee

member.name: M:MCWrapper.RPC.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainRpcRawClient.SignRawTransactionAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object[],System.Object[],System.String)

summary.para: Sign inputs for raw transaction (serialized, hex-encoded).
The second optional argument (may be null) is an array of previous transaction outputs that this transaction depends on but may not yet be in the block chain.
The third optional argument (may be null) is an array of base58-encoded private keys that, if given, will be the only keys used to sign the transaction.
Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.

member.param: Name of target blockchain
String value to identify this transaction
The transaction hex string
An json array of previous dependent transaction outputs
A json array of base58-encoded private keys for signing
The signature hash type. Must be one of: "All", "NONE", "SINGLE", "ALL|ANYONECANPAY", "NONE|ANYONECANPAY", "SINGLE|ANYONECANPAY"

Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Blockchain name is inferred from BlockchainRpcOptions properties.

member.param: The transaction hex string
An json array of previous dependent transaction outputs

member.name: M:MCWrapper.RPC.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainRpcWalletClient.EncryptWalletAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Encrypts the wallet with 'passphrase'. This is for first time encryption.

After this, any calls that interact with private keys such as sending or signing will require the passphrase to be set prior the making these calls. Use the walletpassphrase call for this, and then walletlock call. If the wallet is already encrypted, use the walletpassphrasechange call. Note that this will shutdown the server.
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.

member.param: Name of target blockchain
String value to identify this transaction
The pass phrase to encrypt the wallet with. It must be at least 1 character, but should be long

member.name: M:MCWrapper.RPC.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainRpcWalletClient.EncryptWalletAsync(System.String)

Use the walletpassphrase call for this, and then walletlock call. If the wallet is already encrypted, use the walletpassphrasechange call. Note that this will shutdown the server.
Blockchain name is inferred from BlockchainRpcOptions properties.

member.param: The pass phrase to encrypt the wallet with. It must be at least 1 character, but should be long

member.name: M:MCWrapper.RPC.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainRpcWalletClient.GetStreamKeySummaryAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Returns stream json object items summary for specific key.
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.

member.param: Name of target blockchain
String value to identify this transaction
One of the following: stream txid, stream reference, stream name
Stream key

param.name: mode
param.para: Comma delimited list of the following: jsonobjectmerge (required) - merge json objects, recursive - merge json sub-objects recursively, noupdate - preserve first value for each key instead of taking the last, omitnull - omit keys with null values, ignoreother - ignore items that cannot be included in summary (otherwise returns an error), ignoremissing - ignore missing offchain items (otherwise returns an error), firstpublishersany - only summarize items by a publisher of first item with this key, firstpublishersall - only summarize items by all publishers of first item with this key

summary.para: Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.

member.param: Name of target blockchain
String value to identify this transaction
The multichain addresses to send to (comma delimited)

Permission strings, comma delimited.
Global: connect,send,receive,issue,mine,admin,activate,creat
or per-asset: asset-identifier.issue,admin,activate,send,receive
or per-stream: stream-identifier.write,activate,admin
Native currency amount to send. eg 0.1. Default - 0.0
Block to apply permissions from (inclusive). Default - 0
Block to apply permissions to (exclusive). Default - 4294967295; If -1 is specified default value is used.
A comment used to store what the transaction is for. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.
A comment to store the name of the person or organization to which you're sending the transaction. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.

member.name: M:MCWrapper.RPC.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainRpcWalletClient.LockUnspentAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,MCWrapper.Data.Models.Wallet.CustomModels.Transaction[])
member.summary:
Updates list of temporarily unspendable outputs.
Temporarily lock (unlock=false) or unlock (unlock=true) specified transaction outputs.
A locked transaction output will not be chosen by automatic coin selection, when spending assetss. Locks are stored in memory only. Nodes start with zero locked outputs, and the locked output list is always cleared (by virtue of process exit) when a node stops or fails.
Also see the listunspent call
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.
member.param: Name of target blockchain
String value to identify this transaction
Whether to unlock (true) or lock (false) the specified transactions
A json array of objects. Each object should have the the txid (string) vout (numeric)

member.name: M:MCWrapper.RPC.Ledger.Clients.MultiChainRpcWalletClient.LockUnspentAsync(System.Boolean,MCWrapper.Data.Models.Wallet.CustomModels.Transaction[])
member.summary:
Updates list of temporarily unspendable outputs.
Temporarily lock (unlock=false) or unlock (unlock=true) specified transaction outputs.
A locked transaction output will not be chosen by automatic coin selection, when spending assetss. Locks are stored in memory only. Nodes start with zero locked outputs, and the locked output list is always cleared (by virtue of process exit) when a node stops or fails.
Also see the listunspent call
Blockchain name is inferred from BlockchainRpcOptions properties.
member.param: Whether to unlock (true) or lock (false) the specified transactions
A json array of objects. Each object should have the the txid (string) vout (numeric)

String value to identify this transaction

summary.para: Deprecated for the current version of Multichain; Do Not Use;
If the request parameters include a 'mode' key, that is used to explicitly select between the default 'template' request or a 'proposal'.
It returns data needed to construct a block to work on.
Blockchain name is inferred from BlockchainRpcOptions properties.

param.para: (string, optional) A json object in the following spec
{ "mode":"template" (string, optional) This must be set to "template" or omitted
"capabilities":[ (array, optional) A list of strings
"support" (string) client side supported feature, 'longpoll', 'coinbasetxn', 'coinbasevalue', 'proposal', 'serverlist', 'workid'

member.name: M:MCWrapper.RPC.Ledger.Clients.IMultiChainRpcMining.PrioritiseTransactionAsync(System.String,System.Double,System.Double)

summary.para: Accepts the transaction into mined blocks at a higher (or lower) priority
Blockchain name is inferred from BlockchainRpcOptions properties.

member.param: The transaction id

The priority to add or subtract.
The transaction selection algorithm considers the tx as it would have a higher priority.
(priority of a transaction is calculated: coinage * value_in_satoshis / txsize)

The fee value (in satoshis) to add (or subtract, if negative).
he fee is not actually paid, only the algorithm for selecting transactions into a block considers the transaction as it would have paid a higher (or lower) fee

member.name: M:MCWrapper.RPC.Ledger.Clients.IMultiChainRpcRaw.SignRawTransactionAsync(System.String,System.Object[],System.Object[],System.String)

summary.para: Sign inputs for raw transaction (serialized, hex-encoded).
The second optional argument (may be null) is an array of previous transaction outputs that this transaction depends on but may not yet be in the block chain.
The third optional argument (may be null) is an array of base58-encoded private keys that, if given, will be the only keys used to sign the transaction.
Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Blockchain name is inferred from BlockchainRpcOptions properties.

member.param: The transaction hex string
An json array of previous dependent transaction outputs
A json array of base58-encoded private keys for signing
The signature hash type. Must be one of: "All", "NONE", "SINGLE", "ALL|ANYONECANPAY", "NONE|ANYONECANPAY", "SINGLE|ANYONECANPAY"

member.name: M:MCWrapper.RPC.Ledger.Clients.IMultiChainRpcWallet.EncryptWalletAsync(System.String)

summary.para: Encrypts the wallet with 'passphrase'. This is for first time encryption.

After this, any calls that interact with private keys such as sending or signing will require the passphrase to be set prior the making these calls. Use the walletpassphrase call for this, and then walletlock call. If the wallet is already encrypted, use the walletpassphrasechange call. Note that this will shutdown the server.
Blockchain name is inferred from BlockchainRpcOptions properties.

member.param: The pass phrase to encrypt the wallet with. It must be at least 1 character, but should be long

member.name: M:MCWrapper.RPC.Ledger.Clients.IMultiChainRpcWallet.GetNewAddressAsync(System.String)

summary.para: Returns a new address for receiving payments.
If 'account' is specified (deprecated), it is added to the address book so payments received with the address will be credited to 'account'.
Blockchain name is inferred from BlockchainRpcOptions properties.

member.param: The account name for the address to be linked to. If not provided, the default account "" is used. It can also be set to the empty string "" to represent the default account. The account does not need to exist, it will be created if there is no account by the given name.

member.param: One of the following: stream txid, stream reference, stream name
Stream key

param.name: mode
param.para: Comma delimited list of the following: jsonobjectmerge (required) - merge json objects, recursive - merge json sub-objects recursively, noupdate - preserve first value for each key instead of taking the last, omitnull - omit keys with null values, ignoreother - ignore items that cannot be included in summary (otherwise returns an error), ignoremissing - ignore missing offchain items (otherwise returns an error), firstpublishersany - only summarize items by a publisher of first item with this key, firstpublishersall - only summarize items by all publishers of first item with this key

summary.para: Requires wallet passphrase to be set with walletpassphrase call.
Blockchain name is inferred from BlockchainRpcOptions properties.

member.param: The multichain addresses to send to (comma delimited)

Permission strings, comma delimited.
Global: connect,send,receive,issue,mine,admin,activate,creat
or per-asset: asset-identifier.issue,admin,activate,send,receive
or per-stream: stream-identifier.write,activate,admin
Native currency amount to send. eg 0.1. Default - 0.0
Block to apply permissions from (inclusive). Default - 0
Block to apply permissions to (exclusive). Default - 4294967295; If -1 is specified default value is used.
A comment used to store what the transaction is for. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.
A comment to store the name of the person or organization to which you're sending the transaction. This is not part of the transaction, just kept in your wallet.

member.name: M:MCWrapper.RPC.Ledger.Clients.IMultiChainRpcWallet.LockUnspentAsync(System.Boolean,MCWrapper.Data.Models.Wallet.CustomModels.Transaction[])
member.summary:
Updates list of temporarily unspendable outputs.
Temporarily lock (unlock=false) or unlock (unlock=true) specified transaction outputs.
A locked transaction output will not be chosen by automatic coin selection, when spending assetss. Locks are stored in memory only. Nodes start with zero locked outputs, and the locked output list is always cleared (by virtue of process exit) when a node stops or fails.
Also see the listunspent call
Blockchain name is inferred from BlockchainRpcOptions properties.
member.param: Whether to unlock (true) or lock (false) the specified transactions
A json array of objects. Each object should have the the txid (string) vout (numeric)

member.name: M:MCWrapper.RPC.Ledger.Clients.IMultiChainRpcWallet.LockUnspentAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,MCWrapper.Data.Models.Wallet.CustomModels.Transaction[])
member.summary:
Updates list of temporarily unspendable outputs.
Temporarily lock (unlock=false) or unlock (unlock=true) specified transaction outputs.
A locked transaction output will not be chosen by automatic coin selection, when spending assetss. Locks are stored in memory only. Nodes start with zero locked outputs, and the locked output list is always cleared (by virtue of process exit) when a node stops or fails.
Also see the listunspent call
Blockchain name is explicitly passed as parameter.
member.param: Name of target blockchain
String value to identify this transaction
Whether to unlock (true) or lock (false) the specified transactions
A json array of objects. Each object should have the the txid (string) vout (numeric)
